page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF BLOCK
page.content: Our block is a rural area covering most of the triangle between Milford Haven, Neyland and Johnston. The countryside is undulating. It is mainly managed grass_land, separated by the narrow wooded valleys of small streams. Settlement over most of the block consists of scattered farms and houses except for the village of Rose_ market. Rosemarket was established in the early 12th. Century as a borough and was the market town for the Cantref (hundred) of Rhos. It was built on the site of a much earlier Welsh settlement.Its importance faded and it has been an 'out of the way' village for many centuries. Rosemarket is set on a hill. Each of the six roads leading to the village takes you down a hill, across water then up again.
